Inference¶

Example:

import probpy as pp

prior = pp.normal.med(mu=1.0, sigma=2.0)
likelihood = pp.normal.med(sigma=1.0)

posterior = pp.predictive_posterior(likelihood=likelihood, priors=prior)

## Or just getting modes
prior = pp.normal.med(mu=1.0, sigma=2.0)

modes = pp.mode(prior)
probpy.inference.mode.mode(rv: probpy.core.RandomVariable, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • rv – random variable to find mode for
  • kwargs – arguments to find method
Returns:
probpy.inference.posterior.predictive_posterior(likelihood: typing.Union[probpy.core.RandomVariable, typing.Callable[[typing.Tuple[numpy.ndarray]], numpy.ndarray]], priors: typing.Union[probpy.core.RandomVariable, typing.Tuple[probpy.core.RandomVariable]], data: typing.Tuple[numpy.ndarray] = None, size: int = 1000) → typing.Union[probpy.core.RandomVariable, float][source]¶
Parameters:
  • likelihood – likelihood distribution / function
  • priors – prior / priors
  • data – data passed to likelihood of no analytical solution is implemented
  • size – number of samples in numerical estimate
Returns:

RandomVariable or probability
